title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: Added **read-only data access option** for deployed sparks, allowing users to share apps without granting edit permissions.
Updated deployment notes to clarify data sharing risks and explicitly mention read-only mode.
Included examples (e.g., family calendar app) to illustrate read-only use cases.
Revised UI instructions for selecting data access level during publishing.
summary:
- Added **read-only data access option** for deployed sparks, allowing users to share apps without granting edit permissions.
- Updated deployment notes to clarify data sharing risks and explicitly mention read-only mode.
- Included examples (e.g., family calendar app) to illustrate read-only use cases.
- Revised UI instructions for selecting data access level during publishing.
generated_title: Introduce read-only sharing option for GitHub Spark deployments
commits: **5f0e287**: Merge pull request #57584 from github/repo-sync (by docs-bot)
**1e860a4**: GitHub Spark Read-only option for deployed sparks #19455 (#57545) (by Anne-Marie)
original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
### Summary
- Added **read-only data access option** for deployed sparks, allowing users to share apps without granting edit permissions.
- Updated deployment notes to clarify data sharing risks and explicitly mention read-only mode.
- Included examples (e.g., family calendar app) to illustrate read-only use cases.
- Revised UI instructions for selecting data access level during publishing.

### Title
Introduce read-only sharing option for GitHub Spark deployments
